multiplechoiceresponse.label: What is the role of the cilia in the respiratory system?

choicegroup.choice: C. Moving mucus and trapped particles
D. Assisting with the sense of smell

div.p: Answer: C. Moving mucus and trapped particles
Cilia are tiny hair-like structures that line the airways and move mucus and trapped particles up and out of the respiratory system, helping to keep the airways clear.
